intro: Tarenna gyokushinkwa var. yaeyamensis, commonly known as Yaeyama starling fruit, is a species native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan. It is a small evergreen shrub belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces oval, yellow-orange fruits that are edible and have a sweet, tangy flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
